page.title: 03The Mini Zoo in Skegness
page.content: The manager of Natureland,Mr.Yeadon, told us that it was first opened in 1965 by a Manchester Company.Later they sold it to Mr.Yeadon who built new buildings immediately.The first animals were Californian sealions. They have 60_70 different kinds of fish and several other species of animals such as reptiles,birds, mammals and domestic animals.In 1984 they had a new exhibit of tropical butterflies which were transported as chrysalises.A change for the better would be bigger facilities and more exhibits.Approximately 30 animals are washed up a month and they are mostly baby seals.The cost of keeping the animals comes to Â£500 a month.This marine zoo is well worth a visit.It is not very dear to get in Natureland.
